info.description: Welcome to Xfers' API documentation. You can find information on our API endpoint specific to your country.
info.title: Xfers API

contact.name: Contact us through our help desk

tags.name: Error Response
tags.description:
The API categorises the various failures with Xfers' own error code. The body of the response will be JSON in the following format:
```
error: "string"
error_code: "string"
error_handling: "string"
```
The field `error` returns the error message that is specific to your request, `error_code` returns the category the error and `error_handling` returns the instruction on how to resolve the error.

tags.name: Try it out with Postman
tags.description:
You can test our API with postman collection.

#### Prerequisite  
1. Download Postman App [here](https://www.getpostman.com/downloads/).
2. Create a Postman account.
3. Download the Postman Collection that suits your needs.

#### Xfers Postman Collection
|Singapore|Indonesia|
|--|--|
|[![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/5fa6d37311e7bfc6ef2a)| [![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/453dd7b670533289a719)|

tags.name: Direct Bank Transfer Payments

tags.name: Intents
tags.description:
**For user case 1:**

When a user is performing a top-up via  [GET /transfer_info](http://docs.xfers.io/#get-transfer-info), they might forget to enter their contact number which is needed for our system to identify them.

The Intents API solves this issue by requiring the user to transfer a unique amount to Xfers which will be used to identify them. The difference between the  `unique_amount`  and the actual  `amount`  will be very small, and Xfers provides the difference for free to the user.

Note that this only acts as a backup, and the user should enter his contact number in the comments section when doing a bank transfer whenever possible.

Example: Jane wishes to transfer 5000 Indonesian Rupiah via  `/intents`.

1.  She makes a HTTP GET request to  `/user/transfer_info`  to get the correct Xfers bank to transfer to (we have many banks!). The response tells her to transfer to Bank Central Asia (BCA).
2.  She makes a HTTP POST request to create an intent. The response tells her to make a bank transfer of 4999 to Xfers.
3.  Jane makes a transfer of 4999 to Xfers BCA. Within a few minutes, Xfers detects the transfer and tops up Jane’s Xfers account with 5000. Xfers absorbs the difference for free.
4.  If  `notify_url`  is given, Xfers will send a callback to this url.

Note the above scenario is only valid when disable_va is set to True

**For user case 2:**

Intent can also be use a means to get callback notifications from Xfers when a user successfully fund their virtual account on Xfers.

Example: Jane wishes to transfer 5000 Indonesian Rupiah via  `/intents`  to her virtual Xfers account and get a callback notification when it successful

1.  She makes a HTTP POST request to create an intent with disable_va set to false(default) and provide a  `notify_url`. The response will provide a list of virtual account nos she can fund her account with from a list of bank that Xfers support.
2.  Jane makes a transfer of 500 to the Xfers BCA Virtual account that the intent api provide. Within a few minutes, Xfers detects the transfer and tops up Jane’s Xfers account with 5000.
3.  Since  `notify_url`  is provided, Xfers will send a callback to this url.

tags.name: Callback Configuration
tags.description:
For certain endpoints you might want to receive callbacks when the transaction becomes completed. You can configure them at the dashboard:

Singapore: `https://www.xfers.io/merchant_settings/callback_settings`

Indonesia: `https://id.xfers.com/merchant_settings/callback_settings`

tags.name: Pagination
tags.description:
To do pagination:

1.  Decide on number of entries per page (e.g. 100 for this example). Set the limit as this
2.  First page: Offset 0. The latest 100 entries, 1-100, will be returned.
3.  Second page: Offset 100. The next 100 entries, 101-200, will be returned.
4.  Third page: Offset 200. The next 100 entries, 201-300, will be returned.

Hence your offset should always be a multiple of limits.

post.description:
This API is used to start user registration by inputting phone number.
After this API is called, an OTP SMS will be sent to that number.

You can re-trigger this API to re-send OTP to the same phone number after 1 minute.

This OTP will expire in 10 minutes.
The SMS format will be:
```
[XFERS] Your OTP is 123456. This is to set up payments for `merchant_name` . If this is not done by you, please report to http://bit.ly/XfersSupport
```
This API uses a pair of public key and secret key.
The header of this API uses public key called `X-XFERS-APP-API-KEY`.
You will need `X-XFERS-APP-SECRET-KEY`  to generate signature in the request body.

phone_no.description: User mobile no. It should follow International format.

signature.description: SHA1-hex of (phone_no + X-XFERS-APP_SECRET_KEY). More information on generating SHA1 here http://www.sha1-online.com/

post.description:
This API is used to start private ledger registration by inputting phone number.

 This API uses a pair of public key and secret key.

The header of this API uses public key called `X-XFERS-APP-API-KEY`. You will need `X-XFERS-APP-SECRET-KEY` to generate signature in the request body.

Please make use of Pre-request Script to test this API in postman

phone_no.description: User mobile no. It should follow International format.

signature.description: SHA1-hex of (phone_no + X-XFERS-APP_SECRET_KEY). More information on generating SHA1 here http://www.sha1-online.com/

value.error_handling: Make sure you entered the correct parameters.

get.summary: Get User API Token / Submit OTP
get.description:
After user receives the OTP SMS, merchant's app should capture the OTP and pass it to Xfers via this API.
This API will finish the registration and returns user_api_token. user_api_token is used to control the user's account.
You should save the user_api_token for future usage. (to be put in the `X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY` in headers of other APIs)

It will also return a is_fully_verified if they already have an Xfers account and have completed our KYC process.

This API uses a pair of public key and secret key.
The header of this API uses public key called `X-XFERS-APP-API-KEY`. You will need `X-XFERS-APP-SECRET-KEY` to generate signature in the request body.

parameters.name: otp
parameters.description: User mobile no. It should follow International format.

parameters.name: phone_no
parameters.description: User mobile no. It should follow International format.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: SHA1-hex of (phone_no + OTP + APP_SECRET_KEY). More information on generating SHA1 here http://www.sha1-online.com/

parameters.name: return_url
parameters.description: Url that new user will be redirected after they completed Xfers account registration at `sign_up_url` provided.

put.description:
To provide KYC data in order to change user from unverified status into fully verified status.  

The image/document provided us must be hosted in a URL then pass the URL to Xfers via this API.  
Make sure data type for your image is jpeg / png.  
Maximum size of the image/ document is 10 MB.  

After this data is sent, we will do some verifications on our side and may take some time before user gets fully verified.  In Indonesia, fully verified user will be backed by a savings account.
Thus, there are required parameters which are mother_maiden_name, id_front_url, selfie_2id_url.
Additional data will speed up the KYC process.

id_front_url.description: URL storing the front image of user identity card

selfie_2id_url.description: URL storing the selfie of user holding their id card

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth for account holder in yyyy-mm-dd

identity_no.description: Account holder national identity number or, KTP number of Indonesian.

annual_income.description: Annual income of user in the local currency (SGD/IDR)

id_back_url.description: URL storing the back of the user id card

proof_of_address_url.description: URL storing the proof of address

support_document_1_url.description: URL storing the image/pdf of support documents like proof of user income

support_document_2_url.description: URL storing the image/pdf of support documents like proof of user income

support_document_3_url.description: URL storing the image/pdf of support documents like proof of user income

support_document_4_url.description: URL storing the image/pdf of support documents like proof of user income

support_document_5_url.description: URL storing the image/pdf of support documents like proof of user income

meta_data.description: Addtional data like Jumio info dump.

blood_type.description: Account holder’s blood type, without rhesus. Possible values: ‘A’, ‘B’, 'AB’, or 'O’

rt.description: Only Indonesia. Account holder’s RT according to his/her KTP. Leading zero is optional.

rw.description: Account holder’s RW according to his/her KTP. Leading zero is optional.

administrative_village.description: Account holder’s administrative_village address. In KTP, it is called Kelurahan or Desa.

state.description: Account holder’s state of residence. In KTP, it is called Provinsi.

district.description: Only Indonesia. Account holder’s district address. In KTP, it is called Kecamatan.

religion.description: Only Indonesia. Account holder’s religion according to his/her KTP. Possible Values: 'Islam’, 'Katholik’, 'Kristen Protestan’, 'Hindu’, 'Budha’, 'Kong Hu Cu’, or 'Aliran Kepercayaan’

marital_status.description: Only Indonesia. Account holder’s marital status according to his/her KTP. Possible Values: 'Belum Kawin’, 'Kawin’, 'Janda’, or 'Duda’

occupation.description: Only Indonesia. Account holder’s occupation according to his/her KTP.

get.description:
The main usage of this API is to get the current user. One user can have multiple accounts, and the balance returned is the account tied to the current API token. 
You can also use this API to check various data of the user such as first_name, last_name.

Description of some notable response

Key | Value | Description 
--------------- |  ----------- | -----
kyc_status | fully_verified | current_kyc_status of user, enum of `not_submitted`, `in_process`, `rejected`, `fully_verified`

This API displays the account information, including the storage limits.

 Note that this API is on our newer `v4` endpoint instead of `v3`, so the authorization header is `Authorization` instead of `X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY`. The server URL is `api/v4` instead of `api/v3`.

parameters.name: wallet_id
parameters.description:
Wallet ID of the Xfers wallet. 

`1`: General Wallet

`2`: Digital Goods Wallet

`8`: Settlement Wallet

parameters.name: include_limits
parameters.description: Whether you want the limits to be returned.

object.description: Type of the object. Subject to changes.

limitations.description: Name-value pairs of the various limit amounts and the remaining limits.

max_storage_limit.description: Maximum amount you can store in this account.

max_storage_limit_remaining.description: How much storage limit is remaining for this account.

charge_per_transaction_limit.description: Maximum amount you can Charge per transaction.  (`/charges`)

charge_rolling_yearly_limit.description: Maximum amount you can Charge in a rolling year, 365-days window.  (`/charges`)

charge_rolling_yearly_limit_remaining.description: How much more you can charge for this account. (`/charges`)

get.description:
This API displays a user’s transaction history. 


This API displays a user’s transaction history.

I.e. user’s transactions with other merchants will not be displayed.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Earliest date to query

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Latest date to query

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset results for pagination purposes.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Will only show transactions of that type. You can add additional types by separating with a comma.

metadata.description: This is a charge, money is moving from a customer to the business account
This is a payout, money is moving from the business account to a customer

id.description: ID of the Charge/Payout/Withdrawal/Payout. You can use this ID to query Charges and Payouts.

type.description: Transaction type. Charge and Payout are named as 'Transfer', because they are internal transfers between two xfers accounts.

order_id.description: If it is a charge, it will have a order_id

invoice_id.description: If it is a payout, it will have a invoice_id

amount.description: If money going out of account, negative. If coming in, positive. Note that only a completed Charge will actually deduct money. For example, if a Charge is expired/accepted/pending/unclaimed, no money will actually flow in/out of the wallet, even though there is a amount displayed.

fee.description: Fee charged by Xfers for the transaction, if any. Will be 0 if no fees

metadata.description: Shows additional information about a transaction

activities_returned.description: Number of activities returned. If activities returned is less than the limit, this is the final page.

get.summary: Get Transfer Info / Get Virtual Account Number
get.description:
API to get bank account number to be shown to user.  
Please consult with us to get topup instruction template text to be shown.

The common usage of this API is to parse the transfer_info_array given by us and parse it and use the VA numbers of the bank you want

#### For Virtual Account solution:  
This API is to get the Virtual Account Number to be displayed to the user

#### For non Virtual Account solution:  
This API will show the bank account number to do top up.  
Please consult with us as this solution will require user to use some other identifier to detect the deposit.

id.description: ID of the Charge/Payout/Withdrawal/Payout. You can use this ID to query Charges and Payouts.

amount.description: If money going out of account, negative. If coming in, positive. Note that only a completed Charge will actually deduct money. For example, if a Charge is expired/accepted/pending/unclaimed, no money will actually flow in/out of the wallet, even though there is a amount displayed.

fee.description: Fee charged by Xfers for the transaction, if any. Will be 0 if no fees

metadata.description: Shows additional information about a transaction

activities_returned.description: Number of activities returned. If activities returned is less than the limit, this is the final page.

post.description: API to register user account for esignatures.
API to upload document e-signature

document.description: Document to be signed. Must be in pdf format with maximum size of 20MB

doc_type.description: Can only be Serial or Parallel

get.description: API to check e-signature document status

doc_token.description: Document token that's retrieved after uploading document

x-code-samples.source:
curl --location --request POST "{base_url}/charges" \
  --header "X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY: {{user-api-key}}" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --form "amount=10000" \
  --form "user_api_token={{user-api-token}}" \
  --form "order_id=Order_docs_12345" \
  --form "description=Testing for Documentation" \
  --form "notify_url=https://www.example.com/updates" \
  --form "meta_data=test metadata"

post.description:
The following API will allow you to move money from user's account to merchant's account.  

In header X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY, You need to put `merchant's` api key. (As found in Dashboard > Settings > API Tokens).  
In the user_api_token in the body, You need to put `user's` api key. (As received from get_user_token API).

user_api_token.description: This is your user's api token. You can retrieve this from the Get Token API.

order_id.description: Unique ref no provided by you to prevent double charging, this cannot be repeated.

meta_data.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a charge. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format.

customer.description: Customer email or phone number. If provided, only that user can use the checkout_url returned. If the customer does not exist, an account will be created for them using the email/phone number provided. An OTP will be sent to the email/phone for the user to log in.

return_url.description: URL Xfers will redirect customer to on completion of Xfers checkout.

card_only.description: When this is true, this charge will will attempt to take payments via credit/debit card.

redirect.description: When this is true, instead of the JSON response, Xfers will automatically redirect the request to our checkout page

cancel_url.description: URL Xfers will redirect customer to on cancellation of Xfers checkout.

google_auth.description: When this is true and user_phone_no is provided, instead of phone SMS OTP, user can use Google Authenticator to do OTP. See Authorize a Charge

receipt_email.description: The email address to send this charge’s receipt.

skip_notifications.description: Setting this to true will not send transaction reminders/cancelled/expired emails/SMS. Users will still receive payment completed notification.

get.description: Returns a list of charges you’ve previously created. The charges are returned in sorted order, with the most recent charges appearing first.

Retrieves the details of a charge that has previously been created.
Supply the ID that was returned from your previous request, and Xfers will return the corresponding charge information.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Charge ID that could be retrieved from the response in Create Charge endpoint

post.description:
Authorize a previously created charge. This is an optional process that will allow buyer to skip the sign in flow on Xfers, allowing checkout to be completed on merchant site. If a correct auth_code is provided, the charge will immediately become “accepted” by the buyer.

This endpoint is only used if  `user_phone_no`  param was passed in during charge creation. The response will return the  `transfer_info`  object containing information the bank the user should transfer to. If multiple banks are available, the  `transfer_info_array`  will also be returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Charge ID that could be retrieved from the response in Create Charge endpoint

auth_code.description: Either auth_code or google_auth_code required. SMS OTP code provided to the buyer.

google_auth_code.description: Google Auth OTP code provided to the buyer. If google_auth_enabled of Get Account Info is false, user has not enabled Google Auth with Xfers. Direct users to Xfers 2FA setup page

post.description:
This API will refund a charge.
Both funds and fees in this transaction will be refunded to the user's Xfers account.
Please use the merchant’s API key for this endpoint

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Charge ID that could be retrieved from the response in Create Charge endpoint

post.description: Cancelling a charge that has been previously created by not yet paid. To refund a paid charge, refer to creating a refund.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Charge ID that could be retrieved from the response in Create Charge endpoint

x-code-samples.source:
curl --location --request POST "{base_url}/payouts" \
  --header "X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY: {{user-api-key}}" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --form "user_api_token={{user-api-token}}" \
  --form "amount=15000.00" \
  --form "invoice_id=Order_docs_123" \
  --form "descriptions=Payment for Rent for July"

post.description:
The following API will allow you to move money from merchant's account to user's account.
In header X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY, You need to put merchant's api key. (As found in Dashboard > Settings > API Tokens).
In the user_api_token in the body, You need to put user's api key. (As received from get_user_token API).
Alternatively, You can also make a peer to peer transfer using this API by putting the sender's token in X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY in the header and putting the receiver's token in user_api_token in the body

user_api_token.description: Your user API token which you can retrieve this from the get token API response

invoice_id.description: Unique ref no provided by you to prevent double charging, this cannot be repeated.

description.description: Description of transaction for display purposes

wallet_id.description: Your user API token which you can retrieve this from the get token API response

recipient.description: Either recipient or user_api_token required. Email or Mobile Phone Number of the recipient for this payout.

currency.description: An internal description that you can attach to a payout. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. You will be provided with these meta_data in your queries for payouts.

get.description: Returns a list of payouts you’ve previously created. The payouts are returned in sorted order, with the most recent charges appearing first.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 50 items.

get.description:
Retrieves the details of a payout that has previously been created.
Supply the unique payout ID that was returned from your previous request, and Xfers will return the corresponding payout information.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Payout ID. You can get this from the create payout API.

post.description:
The following API will allow you to move money between wallets belonging to the same user. The API token used in Authorization header should be your customer's API token. 

 Note that this API is on our newer `v4` endpoint instead of `v3`, so the authorization header is `Authorization` instead of `X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY`. The server URL is `api/v4` instead of `api/v3`.

amount.description: Transaction Amount. Please note that you cannot exceed the total wallet storage balance.

external_id.description: Unique ref no provided by you to prevent double charging, this cannot be repeated.

from_wallet_id.description:
Wallet ID of the Xfers wallet to transfer from. Can only choose Settlement Wallet for now. 

`8`: Settlement Wallet

to_wallet_id.description:
Wallet ID of the Xfers wallet to transfer to. 

`1`: General Wallet

`2`: Digital Goods Wallet

get.description:
Retrive a previously created inter wallet payment. You can use this to check the status, whether it has been completed or still processing. The API token used in Authorization header should be your customer's API token. 

 Note that this API is on our newer `v4` endpoint instead of `v3`, so the authorization header is `Authorization` instead of `X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY`. The server URL is `api/v4` instead of `api/v3`.

post.summary: Create Direct Bank Transfer Payment (Coming Soon)
post.description:
The following API will allow you to make a Direct Bank Transfer Payment. Using Direct Bank Transfer has the advantage of having higher transaction limits as compared to normal Charge which uses your wallet balance (`/charges`). The API token used in Authorization header should be your customer's API token.

 In the response, you will have information about the bank account to top up to. Show this information to your customer for them to make a bank transfer. They need to put the `unique_topup_identifier` in the comments field when doing a bank transfer for Xfers to identify that their transfer is for this transaction. 

 Note that this API is on our newer `v4` endpoint instead of `v3`, so the authorization header is `Authorization` instead of `X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY`. The server URL is `api/v4` instead of `api/v3`.

external_id.description: Unique ref no provided by you to prevent double charging, this cannot be repeated.

topup_bank.description: The bank details for your customer to top up to.

unique_topup_identifier.description: Your customer should type this string in the comments field when making a bank transfer. This will be used to identify that the transfer is from him.

get.summary: Get Direct Bank Transfer Payment (Coming Soon)
get.description:
Retrive a previously created direct bank transfer payment. You can use this to check the status, whether it has been completed or still processing. The API token used in Authorization header should be your customer's API token. 

 Note that this API is on our newer `v4` endpoint instead of `v3`, so the authorization header is `Authorization` instead of `X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY`. The server URL is `api/v4` instead of `api/v3`.

post.description:
This API will be used to attach a new bank account to a user.
You will be able to withdraw user's balance to this bank account.
In Indonesia Production, This API will return the detected_name as provided from the bank.
The account_holder_name you provided and detected_name needs to be similar (doesn't need to be 100% match).

bank.description: Bank abbreviation. You can get the list of bank account abbreviation from the Get Bank and Abbreviation Mapping API.

account_holder_name.description: Name of bank account holder name. Put 'PROD_ONLY' in Indo Sandbox

get.description: This will list all bank accounts belonging to the user.

put.description: This request allows you to update an existing bank account record.

parameters.name: bank_account_id
parameters.description: The ID of the bank account. You can retrieve this from in the response of Create Bank Account and List Bank Account API

bank.description: Bank abbreviation. You can get the list of bank account abbreviation from the Get Bank and Abbreviation Mapping API.

account_holder_name.description: Name of bank account holder name. Put 'PROD_ONLY' in Indo Sandbox

delete.description: This request allows you to delete an existing bank account record.

parameters.name: bank_account_id
parameters.description: The ID of the bank account. You can retrieve this from in the response of Create Bank Account and List Bank Account API

post.description:
Withdrawal Time varies upon country. 
For Indonesia, withdrawal time is instantenous.
For Singapore, withdrawal time depends on whether it is an express withdrawal.

#### Withdrawal on Behalf
If you wish to withdraw to a bank account not belonging to you, add in user_api_token in the params.

Behind the scenes, Xfers does a payout of funds from your Xfers account to that user’s Xfers account, followed by a withdrawal. This is required for compliance purposes as we cannot directly withdraw funds to a bank account not belonging to you.

To clarify this:

Placing of xfers_api_token | Flow | Remark
--------------- |  ----------- | -----
merchant's token in header, user's token in body| merchant's Xfers account -> user's Xfers account -> user's bank Account | We call this `Withdrawal on Behalf`
user's token in header, nothing in body| user's Xfers account -> user's bank Account | this is the usual usage
merchant's token in header, nothing in body| merchant's Xfers account -> merchant's bank Account | This is usually done via Xfers Dashboard

parameters.name: bank_account_id
parameters.description: The ID of the bank account. You can retrieve this from in the response of Create Bank Account and List Bank Account API

idempotency_id.description: Unique ref no provided by you to prevent double transaction, this cannot be repeated, Currently only activated for Indonesia

from_wallet_id.description:
Only Singapore.

Wallet ID of the Xfers wallet to withdraw from.

`1`: General Wallet

`2`: Digital Goods Wallet

`8`: Settlement Wallet

express.description:
Only Singapore.

Express Withdrawal has fees but will arrive at recipient bank within 24 hrs.
Standard withdrawal is free but takes 2-3 business day to arrive at recipient bank.
Defaults to false

user_api_token.description: Use this param if you want to withdraw to another user’s bank account instead of your own.

post.description: This is Xfers' callback request to your server to notify withdrawl status

servers.description: This is your endpoint you set in the dashboard or notify_url

idempotency_id.description: The key you put in the withdrawal request

value_date.description: Date of withdrawal completed as provided by partner bank. will only available for "completed" status

failure_reason.description: Reason of failed. Will only available for "failed" status
failure_reason.example: Sample Error Message - Request cannot be processed

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

get.description:
This API will be used to get the current status of withdrawal request.
It is useful if you want to check with Xfers again about the status of your withdrawal request in case there is something wrong with the callback of the withdrawal request status.

parameters.name: withdrawal_request_id
parameters.description: The ID of the withdrawal you want to get information of. You can retrieve this information from the

get.description: This API will be used to get a list of the last 10 withdrawal requests.

post.description:
To close a Xfers-Sobatku Account.
The account needs to fulfill the following conditions:
Fully Verified
Contain no balance
Does not have any pending contracts (transaction)
Please note:
Closing a user’s Xfers-Sobatku account will lower the account limit for this user to a Guest Account Limit of IDR 2.000.000,00
However, user will still be a verified user
To reopen the user’s account, please contact support at http://bit.ly/xferssupport

To close a Xfers-Sobatku Account.
The account needs to fulfill the following conditions:
Fully Verified
Contain no balance
Does not have any pending contracts (transaction)
Please note:
Closing a user’s Xfers-Sobatku account will lower the account limit for this user to a Guest Account Limit of IDR 2.000.000,00
However, user will still be a verified user
To reopen the user’s account, please contact support at http://bit.ly/xferssupport
Creating a Loan. We will pass this loan asynchronously and give callback after complete.

x-code-samples.source:
curl --location --request POST "{base_url}/loans" \
  --header "X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY: {{user-api-key}}" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data "{
	\"customer_data\": {

post.description: After you set up your callback url in {{base-api-url}}/merchant_settings/callback_settings (loan_request_approved), we will send you the callback with the following parameters

servers.description: This is your endpoint you set in the dashboard or notify_url

failure_reason.description: failure reason as given from the bank , only exist on `loan_request_rejected`
failure_reason.example: [{"REASONCODE":"REQ","REMARK":"[JENIS OBJECT/KENDARAAN] IS NOT REGISTERED"},{"REASONCODE":"MAXTENOR","REMARK":"MINIMUM TENOR Exception: 0<1, OBJECT/Car Age : 9 Months"}]

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

get.description:
Get the Detail of a Loan Request Given The id of a its loan.

Available Status:
created -> after customer just created the loan to us
loan_request_processing -> after we called sampoerna loan API and no callback yet
loan_request_approved -> after we just received sampoerna callback and it is approved
loan_request_rejected -> after we just received sampoerna callback and it is rejected
withdrawal_on_behalf_processing -> after they call our WOB API, WOB still in pending state
withdrawal_on_behalf_completed -> after they call our WOB API, WOB still in completed state
withdrawal_on_behalf_failed -> after they call our WOB API, WOB in bank_rejected, they need to retry or this is final state
disbursement_report_processing -> after customer call our disbursement report API
disbursement_report_completed -> after we just call sampoerna disbursement API and completed
disbursement_report_failed-> after we just call sampoerna disbursement API and failed

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

post.description: Create a disbursement report to complete a loan disbursement process. We will pass this loan asynchronously and give callback after complete

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

post.description: After you setup your callback url in {{base-api-url}}/merchant_settings/callback_settings (loan_disbursement_report_completed)

servers.description: This is your endpoint you set in the dashboard or notify_url

failure_reason.description: failure reason as given from the bank , only exist on `disbursement_report_failed`

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

post.description: Create a disbursement report to complete a loan disbursement process. We will pass this loan asynchronously and give callback after complete

parameters.name: loan_id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

idempotency_id.description: idempotency id to indicate your transaction

parameters.name: loan_id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

post.description: This is Xfers' callback request to your server to notify repayment status

servers.description: This is your endpoint you set in the dashboard or notify_url

failure_reason.description: Reason of failed. Will only available for "failed" status

idempotency_id.description: The key you put in the repayment request

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

get.description: Get the Detail of a repayment given its id

parameters.name: loan_id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

parameters.name: loan_repayment_id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

post.description: Get Outstanding Loans. Response of this reconciliation request will be in callback.

page.description: The page number of loan_reconciliation. Starts with 1. Automatically set to 1 if this is not present while per_page is present.

per_page.description: The amount of outstanding loans per page. If this is null or not present, will return all outstanding loans.

from.description: Starting Date of the recon time.

to.description: Ending Date of the recon time.

post.description: Get Outstanding Repayments. Response of this reconciliation request will be in callback.

page.description: The page number of loan_reconciliation. Starts with 1. Automatically set to 1 if this is not present while per_page is present.

per_page.description: The amount of outstanding loans per page. If this is null or not present, will returns all outstanding loans.

post.description:
Note: Disbursement and Withdrawal will be used synonymously. Disbursement is instantenous.
Disbursement (Withdrawal on Behalf)
If you wish to disburse to a bank account not belonging to you, add in user_api_token in the params.
Disbursement (a.k.a Withdrawal) notification
After you setup your callback url in {{base-api-url}}/merchant_settings/callback_settings, we will send you the callback with the following parameter when the withdrawal is completed or failed. You need to acknowledge the callback by responding with a HTTP 200 status when succesfully processed.
We will send completed callback after we have confirmed with the bank that the money has been sent.

parameters.name: loan_id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

idempotency_id.description: Unique ref no provided by you to prevent double transaction, this cannot be repeated, Currently only activated for Indonesia.

user_api_token.description: Use this param if you want to withdraw to another user’s bank account instead of your own. This is your user API token which you can retrieve from the get token API response

get.description: This API will be used to get a list of the last 10 withdrawal requests associated with the loan

parameters.name: loan_id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

post.description: This is Xfers' callback request to your server to notify loan disbursement status

servers.description: This is your endpoint you set in the dashboard or notify_url

idempotency_id.description: The key you put in the withdrawal request

value_date.description: Date of withdrawal completed as provided by partner bank. Will only available for `"completed"` status

failure_reason.description: Reason for failure as provided by partner bank. Will only available for `"failed"` status
failure_reason.example: Request tidak dapat diproses - BusinessException IB-1009 (Mohon maaf transaksi tidak dapat dilakukan. Ulangi beberapa saat lagi.)

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

get.description: This API is used to get the current status of the loan disbursement (in the form of a withdrawal contract), in case the callback of the disbursement status is unclear.

parameters.name: loan_id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Disbursement ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

post.description:
The following request will allow you to create a intent for a transfer and register a callback notification once a transfer has be received or expired(all intents expires in 72 hours.)

User should be prompted to transfer  `unique_amount`  amount to the  `bank_account_no`  and  `bank_name`provided. Once the user deposits with  `unique_amount`, the full amount will be credited to his account.

amount.description: Amount that user intends to transfer

request_id.description: Unique ref no provided by requester. This will need to be unique or the intent request will be considered a duplicate and ignored.

notify_url.description: URL to receive callback notifications when transfer is received

disable_va.description: If true, does not return a Virtual Account for this intent

get.description:
Returns the current pending intent of the user. If multiple intents are created, only the last one is returned.

`transfer_info_array`  is returned so you can display a list of all Xfers banks to transfer to.

parameters.name: disable_va
parameters.description: If true, does not return a Virtual Account for intent

post.description: After intent has been verified(transfer processed)/expired by Xfers, Xfers will send a callback to the `notify_url` you provided. This is a server to server HTTPS POST and you will need to acknowledge the callback by providing a HTTP 200 status.

servers.description: This is your endpoint you set in the dashboard or notify_url

intent_id.description: Xfers’ id unique to each intent

request_id.description: Unique ref number provided by your during your intent call

amount.description: reason for verification status. Only applicable when verification_status is false
amount.example: Amount that user intented to transfer.

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

post.description: Cancelling an intent that has been previously created but not yet completed.

parameters.name: intent_id
parameters.description: Intent ID. You can get this from the create Intent response.

get.description: This will provide you with a list of banks we support. Usually used for Add Bank Account API

example.name: Hongkong and Shanghai Bank Corporation (HSBC) UUS

get.description: Use this endpoint to check connection with our server
Get a mock OTP. This is only usable in sandbox environment

parameters.name: phone_no
parameters.description: Phone Number. For international number, you can use ’%2B’ to replace the plus(’+’) sign. (i.e. use %2B6287785725657 instead of +6287785725657)

patch.description: This API verifies the user with corresponding API KEY. This API can only be called from sandbox.

put.description: You need to wait for a few seconds after withdrawal creation to run this API. Currently only available in Indonesia

idempotency_id.description: Idempotency ID you use to create your withdrawal request

post.description: Mock the Status so you can change its status and get its callback

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the loan you want to request mock status.

post.description: Mock the Repayment Status so you can change its status and get its callback

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the loan you want to request mock status.

parameters.name: repayment_id
parameters.description: ID of the loan repayment you want to request mock status.
